isis.stitle: AUTOMATIC SLACK ADJUSTERS: BENDIX ASA-5 - Description

lev1.para: For service procedures, go to the Bendix web site from the ISIS Suppliers listing.

warning.para: Brake Automatic Slack Adjusters (ASA's) should not need to be manually adjusted in service. ASA's should not routinely have to be adjusted to correct excessive pushrod stroke. Excessive stroke indicates that a problem exists with the foundation brake, ASA, brake actuator, other brake system components or their installation or adjustment.

In the event that a manual adjustment must be made (although this should not be a common practice), a service appointment and full foundation brake, ASA, and other brake system component inspection must be conducted as soon as possible to ensure the integrity of the overall brake system prior to returning the vehicle to service.
Failure to follow this Warning may result in property damage, personal injury or death.
